text_blocks.content: Instruction No. 24: Count Six: Sex Trafficking of a Minor - Statute

The relevant statute for Count Six is Title 18, United States Code, Section 1591, which provides, in pertinent part, that "Whoever knowingly in or affecting interstate commerce, recruits, entices, harbors, transports, provides, or obtains, by any means a person . . . knowing that . . . the person has not attained the age of eighteen years and will be caused to engage in a commercial sex act" is guilty of a crime.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court document related to a sex trafficking case. The text is clear and legible, with no visible redactions or damage.
